executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish on Emerging Markets and China, particularly after the inauguration. He sees a major catch-up trade setting up, similar to 2001. He is also very positive on small caps, healthcare (XBI), Canada Goose, PayPal, and Intel. He expects yields and the dollar to decline in 2025, surprising many investors. He emphasizes the importance of buying quality merchandise when it's marked down, and distinguishing between value traps and true value opportunities with growth potential.

key_reasons: Emerging Markets are at rock bottom cheap relative to the US.
Healthcare sector is poised for a catch-up trade.
The market is misinterpreting the potential impact of tariffs.
Demographics are tailwinds for housing demand and spending.

macro_thesis_summary: Hayes believes that the market is mispositioned for 2025. He anticipates yields and the dollar will decline, contrary to current expectations. He sees a significant opportunity in Emerging Markets and small caps, driven by a catch-up trade relative to the US. He also expects a boom in manufacturing and industrials, supported by reshoring and increased domestic investment. He believes that the FED will cut rates and that the economy will continue to grow, leading to a 'Roaring 2020s' scenario.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: US Duties Collected as a Percentage of Total Imports
key_macro_data_points.value: Near 130-year lows, lower than under Clinton and Carter
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: This indicates that fears of tariffs causing a market crash are overblown. There's a long runway before tariffs become a significant problem.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: Emerging Market Stocks Relative to US Stocks
key_macro_data_points.value: As cheap as they were during the second term of the Reagan era
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: This presents a generational opportunity to make fortunes by investing in Emerging Markets.
This is the beginning of good things to come, similar to 2009 and 2011.
This money has to be put to work, providing fuel for the market rally.

key_macro_data_points.value: In excellent shape, with debt service as a percentage of disposable income near all-time lows
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: This supports the expectation of increased consumption and consumer discretionary spending.

Canada Goose.thesis_summary: Canada Goose is a growth story that turned into a value story and has the potential to turn back into a growth story. The company is focused on reducing wholesale and expanding DTC stores and broader product offerings. The stock is undervalued relative to its free cash flow.
key_metrics: Revenue beat expectations despite a year-over-year decline.
Canada Goose.price_target_or_valuation: Undisclosed, but Hayes is looking for Windows that will make sense to upssize it into a full-size holding
Canada Goose.action: Accumulate on weakness, looking for opportunities to upsize into a full-size holding.

risks_and_contrarian_flags: The market is overly pessimistic about the impact of tariffs.
The consensus is positioned for higher yields and a stronger dollar, creating an opportunity for a surprise reversal.
Energy stocks may underperform in the initial period after a Trump inauguration, contrary to popular belief.
Retailers may underperform after the inauguration in Trump 1.
technical_takeaways: Small caps are breaking out. The 10-year yield seems capped at 5%. The dollar is expensive and likely to roll back over. Healthcare sector is poised for a catch-up trade.
